alert.note: Alert for Alamosa Vicinity, Central San Luis Valley Below 8500 Ft; Del Norte Vicinity, Northern San Luis Valley Below 8500 Ft; Eastern San Juan Mountains Above 10000 Ft; Southern San Luis Valley; Upper Rio Grande Valley, Eastern San Juan Mountains Below 10000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 1:25PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Alamosa, southeastern Rio Grande and central Conejos Counties through 200 PM MDT... At 124 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles east of Monte Vista to near Alamosa to 8 miles north of La Jara to 11 miles southwest of Capulin. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Alamosa, Monte Vista, La Jara, Alamosa East, Capulin, Mosca and Bountiful. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
